channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Hierarchical Time-Aware Mixture of Experts for Multi-Modal Sequential Recommendation
item.description: To address these limitations, we propose a Hierarchical time-aware Mixture of experts for multi-modal Sequential Recommendation (HM4SR) with a two-level Mixture of Experts (MoE) and a multi-task learning strategy.

item.title: Advancing MRI Reconstruction: A Systematic Review of Deep Learning and Compressed Sensing Integration
item.description: Additionally, we summarize key results and trends in DL-based MRI reconstruction, including quantitative metrics, the dataset, acceleration factors, and the progress of and research interest in DL techniques over time.

item.title: Point-LN: A Lightweight Framework for Efficient Point Cloud Classification Using Non-Parametric Positional Encoding
item.description: We introduce Point-LN, a novel lightweight framework engineered for efficient 3D point cloud classification.

item.title: Fast Think-on-Graph: Wider, Deeper and Faster Reasoning of Large Language Model on Knowledge Graph
item.description: Graph Retrieval Augmented Generation (GRAG) is a novel paradigm that takes the naive RAG system a step further by integrating graph information, such as knowledge graph (KGs), into large-scale language models (LLMs) to mitigate hallucination.

item.title: When GNNs meet symmetry in ILPs: an orbit-based feature augmentation approach
item.description: In this work, we investigate the properties of permutation equivariance and invariance in GNNs, particularly in relation to the inherent symmetry of ILP formulations.

item.title: Revisiting Applicable and Comprehensive Knowledge Tracing in Large-Scale Data
item.description: Knowledge Tracing (KT) is a fundamental component of Intelligent Tutoring Systems (ITS), enabling the modeling of students' knowledge states to predict future performance.

item.title: Reducing Action Space for Deep Reinforcement Learning via Causal Effect Estimation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a method to improve exploration efficiency by estimating the causal effects of actions.

item.title: Fat-to-Thin Policy Optimization: Offline RL with Sparse Policies
item.description: Sparse continuous policies are distributions that can choose some actions at random yet keep strictly zero probability for the other actions, which are radically different from the Gaussian.

item.title: HorNets: Learning from Discrete and Continuous Signals with Routing Neural Networks
item.description: We propose HorNets (Horn Networks), a neural network architecture with state-of-the-art performance on synthetic and real-life data sets from scarce-data tabular domains.

item.title: Leveraging Online Olympiad-Level Math Problems for LLMs Training and Contamination-Resistant Evaluation
item.description: Advances in Large Language Models (LLMs) have sparked interest in their ability to solve Olympiad-level math problems.

item.title: TrajFlow: A Generative Framework for Occupancy Density Estimation Using Normalizing Flows
item.description: At the same time, the motion of traffic participants is inherently uncertain.

item.title: Domain Expansion: Parameter-Efficient Modules as Building Blocks for Composite Domains
item.description: Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT) is an efficient alternative to full scale fine-tuning, gaining popularity recently.

item.title: RealCritic: Towards Effectiveness-Driven Evaluation of Language Model Critiques
item.description: In this work, we introduce a new benchmark designed to assess the critique capabilities of LLMs.

item.title: Statistical Verification of Linear Classifiers
item.description: We propose a homogeneity test closely related to the concept of linear separability between two samples.

item.title: Facies Classification with Copula Entropy
item.description: In this paper we propose to apply copula entropy (CE) to facies classification.

item.title: Large-scale and Fine-grained Vision-language Pre-training for Enhanced CT Image Understanding
item.description: In this paper, we propose a fine-grained vision-language model (fVLM) for anatomy-level CT image interpretation.

item.title: DRESSing Up LLM: Efficient Stylized Question-Answering via Style Subspace Editing
item.description: Our approach leverages the over-parameterized nature of LLMs to disentangle a style-relevant subspace within the model's representation space to conduct representation editing, ensuring a minimal impact on the original semantics.

item.title: coverforest: Conformal Predictions with Random Forest in Python
item.description: Conformal prediction provides a framework for uncertainty quantification, specifically in the forms of prediction intervals and sets with distribution-free guaranteed coverage.

item.title: A Zero-Shot LLM Framework for Automatic Assignment Grading in Higher Education
item.description: Automated grading has become an essential tool in education technology due to its ability to efficiently assess large volumes of student work, provide consistent and unbiased evaluations, and deliver immediate feedback to enhance learning.

item.title: Funzac at CoMeDi Shared Task: Modeling Annotator Disagreement from Word-In-Context Perspectives
item.description: In this work, we evaluate annotator disagreement in Word-in-Context (WiC) tasks exploring the relationship between contextual meaning and disagreement as part of the CoMeDi shared task competition.

item.title: Siren: A Learning-Based Multi-Turn Attack Framework for Simulating Real-World Human Jailbreak Behaviors
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) are widely used in real-world applications, raising concerns about their safety and trustworthiness.

item.title: Evaluating and Improving Graph to Text Generation with Large Language Models
item.description: Although we explored the optimal prompting strategies and proposed a novel and effective diversity-difficulty-based few-shot sample selection method, we found that the improvements from tuning-free approaches were incremental, as LLMs struggle with planning on complex graphs, particularly those with a larger number of triplets.

item.title: Improved Vessel Segmentation with Symmetric Rotation-Equivariant U-Net
item.description: While existing equivariant learning approaches attempt to mitigate these issues, they substantially increase learning cost, model size, or both.

item.title: HERMES: A Unified Self-Driving World Model for Simultaneous 3D Scene Understanding and Generation
item.description: Driving World Models (DWMs) have become essential for autonomous driving by enabling future scene prediction.

item.title: Correlation-Based Band Selection for Hyperspectral Image Classification
item.description: In this work, we present a correlation-based band selection approach for hyperspectral image classification.

item.title: Automatic detection and prediction of nAMD activity change in retinal OCT using Siamese networks and Wasserstein Distance for ordinality
item.description: In this work, we proposed deep learning models for the two tasks of the public MARIO Challenge at MICCAI 2024, designed to detect and forecast changes in nAMD severity with longitudinal retinal OCT. For the first task, we employ a Vision Transformer (ViT) based Siamese Network to detect changes in AMD severity by comparing scan embeddings of a patient from different time points.

item.title: Low-rank Prompt Interaction for Continual Vision-Language Retrieval
item.description: Considering that the training parameters scale to the number of layers and tasks, we propose low-rank interaction-augmented decomposition to avoid memory explosion while enhancing the cross-modal association through sharing and separating common-specific low-rank factors.

item.title: BrainGuard: Privacy-Preserving Multisubject Image Reconstructions from Brain Activities
item.description: To overcome these challenges, we introduce BrainGuard, a privacy-preserving collaborative training framework designed to enhance image reconstruction from multisubject fMRI data while safeguarding individual privacy.

item.title: Scalable Benchmarking and Robust Learning for Noise-Free Ego-Motion and 3D Reconstruction from Noisy Video
item.description: We aim to redefine robust ego-motion estimation and photorealistic 3D reconstruction by addressing a critical limitation: the reliance on noise-free data in existing models.

item.title: VideoShield: Regulating Diffusion-based Video Generation Models via Watermarking
item.description: Artificial Intelligence Generated Content (AIGC) has advanced significantly, particularly with the development of video generation models such as text-to-video (T2V) models and image-to-video (I2V) models.

item.title: Towards Automated Self-Supervised Learning for Truly Unsupervised Graph Anomaly Detection
item.description: Self-supervised learning (SSL) is an emerging paradigm that exploits supervisory signals generated from the data itself, and many recent studies have leveraged SSL to conduct graph anomaly detection.

item.title: Investigating the (De)Composition Capabilities of Large Language Models in Natural-to-Formal Language Conversion
item.description: To achieve generalized and robust natural-to-formal language conversion (N2F), large language models (LLMs) need to have strong capabilities of decomposition and composition in N2F when faced with an unfamiliar formal language and be able to cope with compositional gaps and counter-intuitive symbolic names.

item.title: MedAgentBench: Dataset for Benchmarking LLMs as Agents in Medical Applications
item.description: However, a standardized dataset to benchmark the agent capabilities of LLMs in medical applications is currently lacking, making the evaluation of LLMs on complex tasks in interactive healthcare environments challenging.

item.title: Whisper D-SGD: Correlated Noise Across Agents for Differentially Private Decentralized Learning
item.description: Decentralized learning enables distributed agents to train a shared machine learning model through local computation and peer-to-peer communication.

item.title: RAMQA: A Unified Framework for Retrieval-Augmented Multi-Modal Question Answering
item.description: Multi-modal retrieval-augmented Question Answering (MRAQA), integrating text and images, has gained significant attention in information retrieval (IR) and natural language processing (NLP).

item.title: One-Prompt-One-Story: Free-Lunch Consistent Text-to-Image Generation Using a Single Prompt
item.description: Drawing inspiration from the inherent context consistency, we propose a novel training-free method for consistent text-to-image (T2I) generation, termed "One-Prompt-One-Story" (1Prompt1Story).

item.title: Enhancing Biomedical Relation Extraction with Directionality
item.description: Nonetheless, its annotations lack directionality (subject/object) for the entity roles, essential for studying complex biological networks.

item.title: Explainable XR: Understanding User Behaviors of XR Environments using LLM-assisted Analytics Framework
item.description: We present Explainable XR, an end-to-end framework for analyzing user behavior in diverse eXtended Reality (XR) environments by leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) for data interpretation assistance.

item.title: Do Large Language Models Truly Understand Geometric Structures?
item.description: Geometric ability is a significant challenge for large language models (LLMs) due to the need for advanced spatial comprehension and abstract thinking.

item.title: Do as We Do, Not as You Think: the Conformity of Large Language Models
item.description: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) revolutionize the field of intelligent agents, enabling collaborative multi-agent systems capable of tackling complex problems across various domains.

item.title: HumorReject: Decoupling LLM Safety from Refusal Prefix via A Little Humor
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) commonly rely on explicit refusal prefixes for safety, making them vulnerable to prefix injection attacks.

item.title: FedPref: Federated Learning Across Heterogeneous Multi-objective Preferences
item.description: FL circumvents this constraint by carrying out model training in distribution.

item.title: WFCRL: A Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning Benchmark for Wind Farm Control
item.description: In this article, we introduce WFCRL (Wind Farm Control with Reinforcement Learning), the first open suite of multi-agent reinforcement learning environments for the wind farm control problem.

item.title: Spurious Forgetting in Continual Learning of Language Models
item.description: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) reveal a perplexing phenomenon in continual learning: despite extensive training, models experience significant performance declines, raising questions about task alignment and underlying knowledge retention.

item.title: Beyond Task Diversity: Provable Representation Transfer for Sequential Multi-Task Linear Bandits
item.description: In this work, we present the first nontrivial result for sequential multi-task linear bandits without the task diversity assumption.

item.title: Quantized Spike-driven Transformer
item.description: To mitigate this issue, we take inspiration from mutual information entropy and propose a bi-level optimization strategy to rectify the information distribution in Q-SDSA.

item.title: Exact Soft Analytical Side-Channel Attacks using Tractable Circuits
item.description: By leveraging sparse belief messages, this performance is achieved with little more computational cost than SASCA, and about 3 orders of magnitude less than exact inference via exhaustive enumeration.

item.title: DoMINO: A Decomposable Multi-scale Iterative Neural Operator for Modeling Large Scale Engineering Simulations
item.description: Numerical simulations play a critical role in design and development of engineering products and processes.

item.title: Implicit Neural Surface Deformation with Explicit Velocity Fields
item.description: In this work, we introduce the first unsupervised method that simultaneously predicts time-varying neural implicit surfaces and deformations between pairs of point clouds.

item.title: Radio Map Estimation via Latent Domain Plug-and-Play Denoising
item.description: Unlike conventional PnP methods that operate directly in the data domain, the proposed method exploits the underlying physical structure of radio maps and proposes an ADMM algorithm that denoises in a latent domain.
